sections.heading: Thanks
sections.content:
Expressing thanks in Japanese goes beyond simple "thank you." The language has multiple expressions for different formality levels and situations, reflecting the cultural importance of showing gratitude.

ありがとう (casual) ありがとうございます (polite) ありがとうございました (formal/past) Choose based on: - Relationship - Formality level - Timing

children.heading: Casual
children.content: ありがとう "Thanks" どうも "Thanks" (brief) Use with friends/family Informal situations

children.heading: Polite
children.content: ありがとうございます "Thank you" どうもありがとうございます "Thank you very much" Standard form Safe for most situations Most commonly used

children.heading: Formal
children.content: ありがとうございました "Thank you" (completed action) 誠にありがとうございます "Thank you sincerely" Business settings Formal occasions Deep gratitude

children.heading: Stronger gratitude
children.content: 本当にありがとう "Thank you so much" 心から感謝します "I'm truly grateful" 助かりました "You really helped me" When someone went out of their way Major favors

children.heading: For food/treats
children.content: ごちそうさまでした "Thank you for the meal" Use after eating Someone paid for you Cultural expression

children.heading: For help
children.content: 手伝ってくれてありがとう "Thanks for helping" お世話になりました "Thanks for taking care of me" Practical assistance Ongoing support

children.heading: For gifts
children.content: 素敵なプレゼントをありがとう "Thank you for the wonderful present" お気遣いありがとうございます "Thank you for your thoughtfulness"

children.heading: Present tense
children.content: ありがとうございます For ongoing/immediate situations Example: Receiving help right now

children.heading: Past tense
children.content: ありがとうございました For completed actions Example: 先日はありがとうございました "Thank you for the other day" More formal feeling Acknowledging past help

children.heading: Standard responses
children.content: どういたしまして "You're welcome" いえいえ "No, no" とんでもないです "Not at all" Humble and modest Downplaying your effort

children.heading: Casual responses
children.content: いいよ "It's okay" 大丈夫 "No problem" 全然 "Not at all" Friends only

children.heading: Colleagues
children.content: お疲れ様です "Thanks for your work" (acknowledgment) 助かります "That helps / I appreciate it" Common workplace phrases Daily usage

children.heading: To superiors
children.content: ありがとうございます Standard polite form 恐れ入ります "I'm grateful" (very humble) Show respect Formal language

children.heading: Anticipatory thanks
children.content: よろしくお願いします "Thank you in advance / Please help me" Not literal translation Shows humility Requests cooperation

children.heading: Deep gratitude
children.content: 感謝しております "I am grateful" お礼の言葉もございません "I have no words to thank you" Significant help received Formal situations

sections.heading: Common Mistakes
sections.content: ❌ Using ありがとう to strangers/superiors ✓ ありがとうございます ❌ Forgetting ございました for past ✓ 昨日はありがとうございました ❌ Overusing どういたしまして ✓ Use いえいえ or とんでもない more naturally Context and formality matter

sections.heading: Quick Reference
sections.content: Most casual: どうも Casual: ありがとう Standard: ありがとうございます Formal: ありがとうございました Very formal: 誠にありがとうございます Choose based on relationship and situation
